amendment.description: To reduce document fraud, prevent identity theft, and preserve the integrity of the Social Security system, by ensuring that persons who receive an adjustment of status under this bill are not able to receive Social Security benefits as a result of unlawful activity.

action.text: Motion to table amendment SA 3985 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 49. Record Vote Number: 130.

Amendment SA 3985 proposed by Senator Ensign. (consideration: CR S4739-4747; text: CR S4739) To reduce document fraud, prevent identity theft, and preserve the integrity of the Social Security system, by ensuring that persons who receive an adjustment of status under this bill are not able to receive Social Security benefits as a result of unlawful activity.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to table amendment SA 3985 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 49. Record Vote Number: 130.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3985 proposed by Senator Ensign.
